action.action-desc: Ms. Meng (for herself, Mr. McNerney, Mrs. Dingell, Mr. Keating, Mr. Issa, Ms. Eshoo, Mr. Cicilline, and Mr. Royce of California) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To amend title 18, United States Code, to extend the coverage of the Federal prohibition against stalking in order to provide protection to friends and co-workers, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Expanded Stalking Protections Act of 2017.

subsection.text: Section 2261A of title 18, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking Whoever and inserting (a) In general.—Whoever;
in paragraph (1)(A)(iii), by striking or after the semicolon;
by adding at the end of paragraph (1)(A) the following:

clause.text: a friend of that person; or
a co-worker of that person; or

paragraph.text: by adding at the end of the following:
The term co-worker means a person with whom one has a work relationship, without regard to any hierarchy within the organization.
The term friend means a person with whom one has a bond of mutual affection, exclusive of intimate or family relations.

subsection.text: Section 2261A, as amended by subsection (a), is further amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (1)(B), by striking or (iii) and inserting (iii), (iv), or (v);
in paragraph (2)(A), by striking or (iii) and inserting (iii), (iv), or (v); and
in paragraph (2)(B), by striking or (iii) and inserting (iii), (iv), or (v).
